events.name: In Person: Code and Coffee on November 29th from 10am-1pm ET
events.description:
Join us at Mill Mountain Coffee on Saturday, November 29th, 2025 from 10am-1pm ET for a period of collaboration and community-building! As a software developer or aspiring developer you're invited to meet fellow coders, work on projects, share knowledge, and enjoy good company in a relaxed and welcoming environment. Whether you're looking to learn from others, share your own expertise, or simply hand out with like-minded folks, our Code & Coffee event has got you covered.

Come for the coffee, stay for the camaraderie! Our meetup is a judgement-free zone where you can be yourself, ask questions, and get support from fellow developers. You bring your projects, ideas, and enthusiasm, and we provide the atmosphere! See you there!

events.name: In Person-Roanoke: December Meetup at Buffalo Wild Wings near Valley View Mall
events.description: Join us for the RVNUG December Meetup at Buffalo Wild Wings near Valley View Mall. Buffalo Wild Wings near Valley View is located at the old TGIF building. Look forward to seeing you there.

venue.name: Buffalo Wild Wings near Valley View Mall

events.name: In Person-Salem: Getting started with building GenAI-supported apps
events.description:
GenAI is what everyone is talking about these days. But, what actually is a GenAI application? How does the stack differ from what traditional developers may be working with?

In this talk, we'll focus on de-mystifying the stack and help you realize it's not that different than what you think. We'll explore the APIs that wrap the LLMs, tool/function calling, MCP (Model Context Protocol), and more. We'll then dive into the various tools available for developers to use. Come with questions and (hopefully) leave with answers!

Pizza and soft drinks will be provided at the event.

events.name: In Person-Blacksburg-How Ozmo is Solving Complex Support Questions with NLU
events.description:
Search to Conversation: How Ozmo is Solving Complex Support Questions with NLU with David Bates.

We’ll explore Ozmo’s journey from search-based tech support to intelligent, conversational assistance powered by generative AI. You’ll learn how Ozmo handled complex support questions before the rise of large language models, what sparked the shift to conversational AI, and how we developed the Answers API and Ozmo Assistant. We’ll cover the foundational elements of our generative AI solution, share lessons learned during the transition, and highlight how natural language understanding is enabling more scalable, accurate support experiences.

Pizza and soft drinks will be provided.

venue.name: VT Corporate Research Center (sponsored by Ozmo)

events.name: In Person-Salem-Evolutions of Vibe Coding
events.description:
In this talk, Sean Hoar will explore how AI assistants can accelerate different stages of software development. From idea generation and prototyping, to coding, testing, and debugging, AI tools are transforming how developers work. He’ll provide practical examples of where AI can save time, reduce errors, and help teams focus on higher-level problem solving. Attendees will leave with actionable strategies to integrate AI into their workflow and stay ahead in the evolving tech landscape.

Free pizza and soft drinks will be provided.

events.name: Salem-In Person: Traits of Stable Production Applications by Kevin Griffin
events.description:
Traits of Stable Production Applications presented by Kevin Griffin

Being on call for an application is rarely enjoyable. Outages never seem to happen at a convenient time—they're always at 2 a.m., never at 1 p.m. when you're in the right mind to fix them. And when you're fast asleep (maybe!), database failures or stuck CRON jobs are the last thing on your mind.

The best protection against overnight outages is being prolific in battle-hardening your app. In this talk, we'll discuss traits of stable production applications so you and your team can rest well at night.

Topics include logging and telemetry, designing for redundancy, optimizing environments, enabling rapid deployments, testing, and more! For developers or SREs alike, let's talk about proven techniques that'll allow you to sleep soundly at night.

Pizza and soft drinks will be provided at the event.

events.name: In-Person-Blacksburg: "Warming up with weather" at 6pm ET
events.description:
Warming Up with Weather is an exploration of how generative AI and real-time data can make learning code and creativity feel natural. Using live weather data as the foundation, this session demonstrates how to combine APIs, AI models, and visualization tools to generate dynamic, personality-filled forecasts. Attendees will see how natural language prompts and simple Python scripts can bring the weather to life revealing how AI can transform everyday data into interactive, imaginative experiences.

Pizza and soft drinks will be provided.
